main_definition: Guiana is a region in South America, primarily referring to two countries: Guyana (formerly British Guiana) and French Guiana.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An English idiom meaning 'a person', often used informally or colloquially
meanings_and_examples.example: He's a real guyana when it comes to fixing cars.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The name of the South American region encompassing multiple countries and territories, including Guyana and French Guiana.
meanings_and_examples.example: Both Guyana and French Guiana are part of the Guyanan region in South America.
